events.label: Sep 19, 2025
events.note: House passes clean Continuing Resolution (CR) funding bill; Senate rejects it.

events.label: Sep 30, 2025
events.note: Senate votes fail again on both Democratic and Republican funding plans; shutdown imminent.

events.label: Sep 30, 2025
events.note: President Trump meets with Senate Minority Leader Schumer and House Minority Leader Jeffries; no agreement.

events.label: Oct 1, 2025
events.note: Government funding lapses at 12:01 a.m. EDT; partial government shutdown begins, furloughing ~800,000 employees and leaving ~700,000 employed without pay.

events.label: Oct 1, 2025
events.note: Preliminary Senate negotiations on shortening CR timeline; called 'productive discussion' but no agreement reached.

events.label: Oct 2, 2025
events.note: Senate fails fourth time to pass funding legislation; shutdown continues without resolution.

events.label: Oct 2, 2025
events.note: Dept. of Education staff report manipulated out-of-office messages blaming Democrats; alleged Hatch Act violation.

events.label: Oct 3, 2025
events.note: Speaker Johnson extends House recess for another week amid prolonged shutdown.

events.label: Oct 5, 2025
events.note: Shutdown enters fifth day; government still partially closed as negotiations stall.

events.label: Oct 6, 2025
events.note: Day 6: Senate votes at 5:30 PM ET on stopgap funding bill; lacks 60 votes needed to advance. White House press conference at 1 PM ET.

events.label: Oct 6, 2025
events.note: Trump announces federal worker layoffs 'underway right now'; ~2M employees without pay, including military and air traffic controllers.
